newsitem.title: GERMANY: SAP tumbles in early bourse trade.
newsitem.headline: SAP tumbles in early bourse trade.

text.p: Shares in German business software firm SAP AG started bourse dealings down nearly 21 percent on Wednesday, continuing their pre-bourse decline after an unexpected profit warning late on Tuesday.
After a 25 minute delay during which no trades took place in the stock, SAP's preferred shares opened down 57.40 marks at 220 marks, slightly above a low of 210 marks hit in bourse trade.
SAP's decline also dragged down the DAX index, which was down 16.72 points at 2,702.28 points at 0904 GMT, after starting the session slightly ahead before SAP's plunge kicked in.
SAP's ordinary shares, which are not part of the blue chip DAX index, were down 58.20 marks at 219.20.
The high-flying company stunned markets on Tuesday evening with an unexpectedly sharp slowdown in growth in the third quarter that forced the company to revise full-year forecasts.
SAP revised down its 1996 revenue forecast to 3.5 billion marks from the 3.8 billion marks previously expected.
